title: Crochet retires 17 straight as Red Sox swipe G1
content: Garrett Crochet retired 17 consecutive batters in a sparkling pitching performance, and pinch-hitter Masataka Yoshida lined a two-run single that sent the Boston Red Sox past the New York Yankees 3-1 on Tuesday night in their AL Wild Card Series opener.

title: WNBA players back Collier in ripping league
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: Agent: Hill's surgery went well, WR to play in '26
content: Tyreek Hill will not need another surgery after undergoing a major procedure Tuesday to repair his dislocated left knee and multiple torn ligaments, agent Drew Rosenhaus told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Saleh rues 'wrong choice of words' in Coen spat
content: San Francisco 49ers defensive coordinator Robert Saleh told reporters on Tuesday that he "could have found a better choice of words" during his argument with Jacksonville coach Liam Coen on Sunday, following the Jaguars' 26-21 victory at Levi's Stadium.

title: Kuminga, Warriors end stalemate with 2-year deal
content: Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors ended a monthslong stalemate Tuesday, reaching agreement on a two-year deal worth $48.5 million.

title: LeBron out to start camp; eyeing longer ramp-up
content: LeBron James was sidelined to open training camp Tuesday with what the Lakers are calling "a little bit of nerve irritation in the glute."

title: Skubal ties Tigers record with 14 Ks in G1 win
content: Tarik Skubal, who is favored to win his second straight American League Cy Young Award, tied a franchise postseason record with 14 strikeouts, and the Detroit Tigers defeated the Cleveland Guardians 2-1 on Tuesday in Game 1 of their AL Wild Card Series.

title: 📈 NFL Power Rankings: Biggest offensive issues
content: We stacked every NFL team ahead of Week 5. Who jumped up our 1-32 list? Plus, let's pick out the biggest offensive concerns for each roster.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: The 12 teams currently in and the four on the cusp
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: 'There is a personal side of it all:' How NFL QBs and refs approach their in-game chats
content: Aaron Rodgers is 'humorous.' Patrick Mahomes wants to be informed. Here's what QBs and refs say about their conversations.

title: Mourinho reception at Stamford Bridge shows how far Maresca needs to go with Chelsea
content: Maresca's Chelsea beat Mourinho's Benfica in the Champions League, but the reception from fans made it clear which manager is revered.

title: As Pogba nears return, Man City's Monaco visit offers glimpse of what might've been
content: Three years ago, Man City wanted to take Paul Pogba. Instead, he returned to Juve, where his career unraveled.

title: Here's who our experts pick to win every round of the 2025 MLB playoffs
content: Which will be the last team standing in October? Our MLB experts predict which teams will win each series of the postseason.

title: 'Dana White's Contender Series': Four fighters win by finish to earn UFC contracts in Week 8
content: "Dana White's Contender Series" continues to prove it's a fruitful path to fighting in the UFC. Find out which fighters can earn a contract this week.

title: What went wrong and what needs to happen next for the U.S. Ryder Cup team
content: Who should be the next captain for Team USA? How can Scottie Scheffler turn around his Ryder Cup record? We answer some of the biggest questions facing the U.S. ahead of 2027.

title: How Europe backed up Rory McIlroy's words and won the Ryder Cup on the road
content: Two years ago in Rome, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Europe's gutsy team play made it come true.

title: How one city’s tragedy birthed a standard for a championship years in the making
content: For 30 years, the Oklahoma City bombing -- the most devastating act of homegrown terrorism in history -- has been seared into the identity of the city. Since 2008, the Thunder have been trying to honor it -- and give the fans a new one.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Kuminga's $48.5 million deal with Warriors
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Why Karim López looms as Mexico's first NBA star
content: The Sonora teenager is poised to become the first Mexican-born player to be drafted in the NBA's first round, a feat that would lift his local celebrity to unlimited heights.

title: Oregon in OT? Bama's redemption? Ranking the 25 best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: Winners and losers of Kirill Kaprizov's NHL record-setting contract
content: Here's how Connor McDavid, Mikko Rantanen, Kyle Connor and others should feel after the winger's new pact.

title: Post-Ducks crashout, how Trevor Zegras can recapture the 'magic' with the Flyers
content: The cover athlete from EA Sports' NHL 23 hit a wall in Anaheim, but gets a reset after a trade to Philly.

title: Pickups: Replacing Malik Nabers, surprising RB options
content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 5.

title: Hamilton's love for Roscoe made F1 superhero relatable, human
content: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton is nothing short of a superhero, but his relationship with bulldog Roscoe made him feel like one of us.

title: Is the original Bloodline's return imminent?
content: Roman Reigns joined The Usos at Raw. It was his first time in a WWE ring since being stretchered off at Clash of Paris in August.

title: 'Don't you talk s--- about Steven Seagal': MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: WNBA coaching tracker for 2026: Wings part with Chris Koclanes
content: The WNBA coaching carousel starts with openings at Dallas, Seattle and New York, plus new teams Portland and Toronto.

title: Revisiting every big transfer from this summer: Should our expectations be dialed back?
content: This summer had its share of blockbuster moves, but how have they panned out so far? Do we need to scale back our expectations of these players -- or expect even more?

title: Ruben Amorim running out of excuses: The numbers don't lie
content: Soccer management is ultimately a numbers game, and none of them are adding up for Man United's manager.

title: College football betting: Buckeyes, Ducks the favorites for national title, Heisman
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet them.

title:
NFL Week 5 betting lines: Chiefs are MNF road favorites in
 Jacksonville
content: Chiefs are favored for Monday Night Football, Lions are the biggest road favorite of the Week 5 NFL slate

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool and Man United could vie for Carlos Baleba
content: Liverpool and Manchester United could go head to head over Brighton's Carlos Baleba. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Andrew Nembhard, Brandon Miller among top middle-round targets
content: Building a championship-caliber roster means finding solid contributors after the early rounds of your draft. Here are eight to focus on.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Charge sheet filed against rapper Vedan and others for ‘ganja’ consumption
content: The accused have been charged under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and they were let off on bail after their arrest

title: RSS general secretary hails “unwavering” public support for the Sangh through its 100-year journey
content: The Sangh consistently sought consensus on matters of Hindu unity, national security, social harmony, democracy, and preservation of culture, says Mr. Hosabale, adding that acceptance grew steadily over time

title: Speculating on ‘Kathipara’
content: ‘The entire area has a lot of streets that have Army connotations — Lashkarkhana (a camp), Asarghana (Afsar Khana or Officer’s Enclave), Butt Road (there was a rifle practice butt here), Magazine Road, North Parade, etc.’

title: When 50 people died in two Sunday stampedes in Chennai
content: The deaths of 50 people in two stampedes, both of which occurred on Sundays, in Chennai, 20 years ago, would illustrate how lessons in crowd management are rarely learned

title: Two police constables arrested for raping young woman in Tiruvannamalai
content: The 19-year-old survivor, who hails from Andhra Pradesh, was picked up by the duo after stopping the truck she was travelling in for checking documents

title: When an industrialist’s saree giveaway at Palani ended in stampede on Gandhi Jayanthi
content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

title: Punjab seeks special package for flood damages; Centre says it stands shoulder to shoulder with people of Punjab
content: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
content: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
content: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: RSS should continue to focus on nation-building for next 100 years, says former Congress MP Karan Singh
content: Though Mr. Singh’s stance is at odds with the Congress’s official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Karur stampede: What triggered the chaos
content: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

title: Wangchuk served NSA detention order: Ladakh administration
content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting “self-immolation” to people of Ladakh on “multiple occasions” on “lines of protests in Tibet”

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk’s release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk’s wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‘tariff terrorism’ will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: "False": DK Shivakumar Says Bengaluru Pothole Didn't Cause Student's Death
content: The BJP has alleged that Dhanushree, a final-year B-Com student, died after she came under the wheels of a tipper truck while trying to avoid a pothole in Bengaluru.

title: "I Love Tariffs": Trump Defends His Trade Policy, Says It's "Making US Rich"
content: US President Donald Trump has defended his much-criticised trade policy, saying 'tariff' is his favourite word in the English dictionary and credited it for making America 'rich'.

title: Over 90 Students Trapped In Rubble After Indonesian School Collapse
content: At least 91 students remain trapped in concrete rubble almost two days after an Islamic school building collapsed on them, authorities said after reviewing attendance records and reports from anxious families of those missing.

title: Rs 40-Lakh Elephant Stolen In Jharkhand, Sold For Rs 27 Lakh In Bihar
content: A female elephant, allegedly stolen from Jharkhand's Palamu district and sold for Rs 27 lakh, has been rescued from Chapra district of Bihar, police said on Tuesday.

title: Zubeen Garg's Manager, Singapore Event Organiser Arrested In Singer's Death Case
content: North East India Festival (NEIF) chief organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta and Zubeen Garg's manager Siddhartha Sharma have been arrested in connection with the singer's death in Singapore, police said on Wednesday.

title: Apple Sued For Firing Jewish Employee After Denying Sabbath Time Off
content: The US agency that enforces workplace anti-discrimination laws sued Apple on Tuesday, claiming the manager of a retail store made antisemitic comments and denied a Jewish employee's requests for time off before firing him.

title: Karnataka Couple, Child Injured In Suspicious Blast At Home
content: A couple was critically injured, and their child suffered minor injuries in a suspicious blast in their home in Karnataka's Alur district on Tuesday morning.

title: Delhi's Kashmiri Gate Traffic Jams To Ease, Government Plans New Rs 500 Crore Flyover
content: Delhi commuters may soon get some relief from the daily gridlock at Inter-State Bus Terminal (ISBT). Officials say the government is working on a plan to construct a new flyover connecting Nigambodh Ghat (near Margat Wale Baba) to Majnu Ka Tilla

title: "Most Beautiful": Trump Says Asim Munir Praised Him For India-Pakistan Truce
content: US President Donald Trump doubled down on his claim of brokering a truce between India and Pakistan during military conflict earlier this year.

title: Death Count In Massive Philippines Earthquake Rises To 31, Over 100 Injured
content: Rescuers searched collapsed buildings for survivors Wednesday after a powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake jolted the central Philippines, killing at least 31 people on the island of Cebu with fears the toll could rise.

title: Weather Office Warns Of 'Above-Normal' Rain In India For October
content: India is expected to receive 15 per cent more rainfall than normal in October, following bountiful rains during the four-month monsoon season, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Tuesday.

title: 75-Year-Old Man Marries 35-Year-Old, Dies Before Honeymoon
content: Sangruram, a 75-year-old man, married a woman less than half his age, hoping for companionship after years of solitude. But by the morning after the wedding, he was dead.

title: Human Skin Cells Turned Into Fertilisable Eggs For First Time
content: Scientists said Tuesday they have turned human skin cells into eggs and fertilised them with sperm in the lab for the first time -- a breakthrough that is hoped to one day let infertile people have children.

title: Trump Targeting Pro-Palestinian Students "Suppression Of Free Speech": US Court
content: The Trump administration's policy of arresting and trying to deport international students for protesting in support of the Palestinians is blatant and illegal suppression of free speech, a judge said Tuesday.

title: Auto Driver Arrested In UP For Raping, Killing Sex Worker In Mumbai: Cops
content: A 34-year-old autorickshaw driver was arrested from Uttar Pradesh' Mathura days after he allegedly raped and murdered a sex worker in Mumbai, officials said on Tuesday.

title: 19 Killed After 6.9 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Central Philippines
content: The death toll from a magnitude 6.9 quake in the central Philippines has risen to 19, local officials said early Wednesday.

title: Trump Says Harvard University To Settle Government Dispute For $500 Million
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday his administration was close to reaching a $500 million financial settlement with Harvard under which the elite academic institution would operate trade schools.

title: Trump Trade Chief Says 55% China Tariffs A "Good Status Quo"
content: U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports of around 55% are a "good status quo," but the Trump administration would like to find areas where bilateral trade could increase more freely, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Tuesday.

title: US Government On Brink Of Shutdown After Senate Rejects Funding Bills
content: The US government barreled towards its first shutdown in six years Tuesday, with funding expiring at midnight after Democrats fought a war of words with Donald Trump and senators rejected a last-ditch bid to keep the lights on.

title: BJP moves to consolidate votes in Bihar, to pull out Madhya Pradesh playbook
content: Bhojpuri singer Pawan Singh, whose independent candidacy led to NDA’s defeat in Karakat in 2024 Lok Sabha elections, has been pulled back into the party fold. The party is also planning to field many senior leaders, including Union Ministers, in the Assembly polls as it did in Madhya Pradesh

title: U.P. PGT exam postponed again; aspirants, Opposition slam government’s repeated delays
content: Students allege that this is the fifth time the examination, whose notification was released in April 2022, has been postponed, citing unavoidable reasons

title: Indian Railways to launch first assured-transit container train from Delhi to Kolkata in October
content: The bi-weekly service will run from Inland Container Depot (ICD) Tughlakabad in Delhi, to CONCOR’s CTCS terminal in Kolkata via Agra and Kanpur.

title: CM says some journalists are acting as a catspaw of their corporate owners
content: Corporate-controlled media is pursuing an aggressive news agenda that sought to divide the country along religious lines to obfuscate the livelihood issues plaguing the people

title: Over 3,000 students in Tirupattur mourn Karur stampede
content: According to a press release, students also took a pledge for their commitment to safety and observed a moment of silence in a tribute to the departed

title: U.P. Police initiate demolition action against properties linked to Bareilly cleric’s aide
content: 16 rioters who attacked the police in Bareilly with bricks, stones, and bottles of acid were arrested by the police

title: Bridging the fighter jet gap is top priority: IAF Deputy Chief
content: We are looking at the LCA Mk2 and have also invested in the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft, which represents the future of indigenous combat platforms. However, these projects will take time to mature. In the immediate future, we need to bridge the capability gap

title: Kerala Govt. receives nearly 18,000 petitions during human-wildlife conflict mitigation programme
content: Second phase of programme will commence on October 1. Over the next four days, the complaints will be categorised, following which district-level meetings, chaired by the Minister in-charge of districts, will be held

title: FIR filed against Maharashtra Congress over social media post
content: Mumbai Police registers FIR against unidentified person for allegedly inciting violence through social media post showing BJP office on fire amidst protests

title: After controversy, CJI Bhushan Gavai’s mother undecided on being chief guest at RSS event
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh had extended an invite to Kamala Gavai for its Vijayadasami celebration which will be held in Amravati on October 5

title: India got 8% more monsoon rain this year
content: While northern India saw extremely heavy spells, causing loss of life and property, east and northeast regions got lesser rain than usual

title: KBR National Park being turned into a walkers’ park, allege nature lovers
content: Designed to be a forested sanctuary in centre of Hyderabad, it is witnessing construction and landscaping more suited to an urban recreation space with rows of cement blocks, hedge plantations, gazebos coming up inside the park; naturalists allege biodiversity erosion and disturbance to wildlife

title: Nine migrant workers killed, one injured in construction site accident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: The workers, all from Assam, were working at a height of over 20 feet when the iron scaffolding installed for the construction of an arch collapsed; Kattur police file case, begin probe into incident

title: Heavy rush continues on ninth day of Dasara at Indrakeeladri
content: Kanaka Durga temple sees thousands of devotees flocking for darshan of the goddess in the special Durga Ashtami alankaram, while authorities ensure smooth access, prasadam distribution, and facilities for the elderly and differently-abled.

title: IMD forecasts above normal Northeast monsoon in most parts of Tamil Nadu
content: RMC officials say a low-pressure area is likely to form today and intensify into a depression; it will cross south Odisha-north Andhra Pradesh coasts on October 3; parts of T.N. may also get rain as the system moves closer

title: Splendour marks ‘Surya Prabha Vahana’ seva in Tirumala
content: The processional deity of Lord Malayappa, dressed in the attire of Lord Badrinarayana, has been taken out in a grand procession, providing a visual feast to the scores of devotees

title: Bengaluru accounts for over 51% of all cybercrimes in metro cities in 2023: NCRB data
content: Among metropolitan cities, Bengaluru reported the highest number of cybercrime cases, contributing 51.92% of all cases across the 19 metros

title: Boom-and-bust cycles of sardine linked to monsoon and oceanographic changes, says CMFRI study
content: The study by CMFRI integrated fisheries biology and oceanographic data from Kochi, Vizhinjam, and Kozhikode

title: Kerala leads in chargesheeting rate but records alarming rise in suicides
content: According to data from National Crime Records Bureau for 2023,  Kerala  has reported the highest chargesheeting rate under Indian Penal Code crimes at 95.6%

title: Chief Minister announces ₹8,500 top-up over NDRF compensation for flood-hit farmers
content: The Chief Minister, who did an aerial survey, said that over 9.6 lakh hectares of crops have been damaged across the State, of which 9.03 lakh hectares were in just eight northern districts

title: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh: A look at its origins, ideology and rise (1925-1966)
content: The RSS rose amid India’s battle to overthrow the British Raj, with the aim of establishing a ‘Hindu nation’ via cultural and religious revival

title: Chirag Paswan slams Tejashwi Yadav over ‘power bank’ jab, says the RJD is dividing Bihar
content: In response to Yadav’s remark that the NDA considers the EBCs a vote bank while they were a ‘power bank’, Paswan said he never categorised Biharis, they were all ‘people of Bihar’ to him

title: Majority of bonemeal, rubber processing units at Edayar have complied with norms, claims KSPCB
content: These 20 units were served closure or closure-intention notices for violation of environmental norms between April 2024 and January 2025 by the board

title: Andhra Pradesh Finance Department to clear bills  worth ₹400 core to small contractors
content: These bills pertain to the works completed between 2014 and 2019, and kept pending by the previous government

title: Odisha bypoll a litmus test for all three party leaders
content: The bypoll is set to shape the leadership of Odisha CM Mohan Majhi, BJD chief Naveen Patnaik, and OPCC president Bhakta Charan Das, each facing their first election in a new role

title: Over 1.73 lakh killed in road accidents in 2023; over-speeding a major cause: NCRB
content: The fatalities increased by 17,261 from the count in 2022, with two-wheelers accounting for maximum such accidents causing 79,533 deaths. Most of the deaths in two-wheeler accidents were reported in Tamil Nadu (11,490 deaths) and Uttar Pradesh (8,370 deaths).

title: Zubeen Garg death probe: Manager Siddharth Sharma and Singapore festival organiser arrested
content: Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta and late singer Zubeen Garg’s manager, Siddhartha Sharma, have been arrested in Delhi and brought to Guwahati. Mahanta was reportedly hiding in Singapore, facing lookout notices. Assam DGP Harmeet Singh confirmed a transparent investigation, with teams deployed and a logical conclusion expected within seven days, urging public trust in the ongoing legal process.

title: Bihar SIR: 6% drop in voters; 3.7 lakh electors declared ‘ineligible’
content: Bihar's final electoral roll for the upcoming assembly elections is 7.4 crore, reflecting a 6% drop from the pre-revision count. This figure follows the Special Intensive Revision, which involved deleting 3.7 lakh ineligible names and adding 21.5 lakh new voters. The process, initially marked by 65 lakh deletions, had previously sparked significant opposition protests.

title: Deadlock deepens: US heads toward first shutdown since 2019
content: The US federal government is on the brink of a shutdown after Democrats and Republicans blocked each other’s funding plans in the Senate. This partisan deadlock, driven by healthcare spending disputes, guarantees a shutdown from Wednesday, potentially furloughing hundreds of thousands of federal workers amid escalating political tensions.

title: Asia Cup fallout: Mohsin Naqvi humiliated in front of ACC officials; BCCI lashes out
content: BCCI strongly objected to ACC President Mohsin Naqvi taking the Asia Cup trophy and medals after India's win. At the ACC AGM, BCCI representatives cornered Naqvi, refusing his offer for Suryakumar Yadav to collect them due to Naqvi's anti-India posts. The issue is now deferred for mediation, with India threatening an ICC complaint.

title: 'No fault on my part': Vijay targets Stalin over stampede; reveals why he hasn't met victims
content: TVK president Vijay broke his silence on the Karur stampede, denying fault and questioning why the tragedy occurred only there. He urged CM Stalin to target him instead of his supporters, expressing deep grief over the incident. Vijay vowed to meet victims soon and continue TVK's political journey with renewed strength.

title: Phoebe Gates on her father: How she ‘forced Bill Gates to talk to other dads'
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' youngest daughter, revealed how she actively helped her shy father overcome his awkwardness from a young age. She recounted pushing him to socialize at events, even father-daughter dances. Phoebe also shared their intense competitive streak, particularly when she introduces new boyfriends, and how she navigates being recognized as "Bill's daughter" by embracing her own identity.

title: Unbelievable! Shubman Gill's Test redemption: Three phone calls, ego & data
content: Three phone calls changed Shubman Gill’s destiny — one from Steven Smith, another from Kane Williamson, and the most defining, from Sachin Tendulkar. It was the God of cricket’s stern advice that forced Gill to shed his ego, tweak his technique, and script one of the greatest batting series ever by an Indian captain in England

title: I-T drive to target tax evasion on capital gains in joint deals
content: The income tax department is launching a drive to nudge 25,000-30,000 landowners in Kolkata and Bengaluru, identified for not paying capital gains tax on joint development agreements. This campaign, extending to other cities, encourages voluntary compliance through emails, offering updated returns for recent cases and a 25% additional payment for older ones to avoid penalties.

title: More than 90% companies have seen their AI investments failing, says study
content: New research identifies "workslop," poor quality AI-generated content, as the reason 95% of corporate AI investments yield no returns. This deceptive output, lacking substance, burdens employees with corrections. A survey found 40% of US workers recently received workslop. Experts advise leaders to implement clear guidelines for intentional AI use, ensuring meaningful contributions and preventing increased workload.

title: Women's World Cup: Deepti Sharma leads India to 59-run win over SL
content: India clinched a 59-run victory against Sri Lanka in their 2025 ICC Women’s ODI World Cup opener, powered by Deepti Sharma's exceptional all-round display. Sharma (53 runs, 3/54) and Amanjot Kaur (57 runs) rebuilt India's innings after a collapse, setting a 271-run target. Indian bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 211, securing a crucial win despite earlier rain delays.

title: 'I’m untouchable': Delhi 'godman' misled cops with UK number
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati, accused of harassing female students, attempted to mislead police using a London WhatsApp number. Investigators found a CCTV monitoring app and an obscene photo on his phone. He also allegedly engaged girls in honey-trapping, instructing one to send obscene photos with a boy for money.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for October 1 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari of Anand Rathi recommends buying HUDCO, IFCI, and City Union Bank today. HUDCO and IFCI are poised for uptrend continuation after retesting their 200 DEMA, offering attractive risk-reward. City Union Bank shows a breakout from consolidation with an inverse head & shoulder pattern, indicating further upside.

title: Accenture lays off thousands: CEO says we are 'exiting' employees
content: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.

title: Quantum breathing, hypnotherapy: Secret behind Sundar, Sai Sudharsan's mental mastery
content: Washington Sundar and Sai Sudharsan’s recent rise in red-ball cricket is rooted not just in skill but in mental mastery. Behind the scenes, mental conditioning coach Raymun Roy has blended yoga, neuroscience, and cricket analysis into a unique framework. Techniques like quantum breathwork, hypnotherapy, and visualization have helped the duo stay calm, focused, and dominant under pressure.

title: Wangchuk’s arrest: Wife Angmo calls anti-national claims 'blatant lies'; vows fight
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Gitanjali Angmo, vehemently condemned "blatant lies" and "baseless" anti-national narratives against him. She labeled his recent NSA arrest and transfer to Jodhpur jail a "witch-hunt" aimed at weakening his Ladakh Sixth Schedule movement. Angmo pledged to use the legal system, challenging accusers with facts, asserting they will not rest until truth prevails.

title: Israel-Hamas peace plan: Pak sending troops to Gaza? Spotlight on 'peacekeeping force'
content: Pakistan's foreign minister announced the leadership will consider sending troops to Gaza as part of a Muslim nations' peacekeeping force under a US-backed peace deal. This initiative, unveiled by Donald Trump, proposes Hamas disarmament, hostage release, and a technocratic Palestinian government overseen by an international body, with a deadline for Hamas to accept.

title: 31 killed in Philippines: 6.9 magnitude quake jolts island nation; Bohol worst hit
content: A powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines, claiming at least 20 lives with numbers expected to climb. The tremor caused landslides, damaged a church, and cut power. While local authorities warned of a minor sea-level disturbance, the Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre confirmed no tsunami threat, urging residents to remain cautious near coastal areas.

title: Extremist violence dips 63% in 2023; jihadi attacks down 87% - NCRB report
content: India recorded a sharp decline in extremist, insurgent, and terrorist violence in 2023, with incidents plummeting from 446 to 163. Jihadi terrorism and North-East insurgency saw significant reductions. While overall casualties decreased, a concerning 50% rise in police and army personnel deaths was noted. Alarmingly, extremists looted 706 arms and nearly 20,000 rounds of ammunition, a dramatic increase from 2022.

title: Dutch cargo ship attacked: Houthis claim missile launch in Gulf of Aden
content: Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a missile strike on the Dutch-flagged Minervagracht in the Gulf of Aden, injuring two crew and setting the ship ablaze. This serious assault, outside their usual Red Sea operations, expands their campaign against shipping in response to the Gaza war, disrupting maritime traffic and highlighting regional tensions.

title: Post-Ladakh firing, Omar says can’t hit streets for statehood
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah ruled out street protests for statehood restoration, citing the danger from "trigger-ready forces" after the recent Ladakh unrest. He vowed to pursue the demand politically and peacefully, prioritizing young lives over confrontation. Abdullah highlighted Leh's reversal on Article 370 abrogation, noting their initial celebration turned to regret, underscoring the shift in regional sentiment.

title: Why Adam Sandler refused to advise Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift on their relationship
content: Adam Sandler discussed Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's engagement at the New York Film Festival, stating he wouldn't offer marriage advice. He emphasized Kelce's deep love for Swift, mirroring his own marriage, and highlighted the importance of being happy and authentic together. Sandler also revealed his family's admiration for Swift's music, making him a "Swiftie."

title: Asia Cup: Imran Khan slams PCB chief; claims Mohsin Naqvi ruining Pak cricket
content: Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi faced severe backlash after Pakistan's Asia Cup defeat to India. Indian players notably refused to accept the winner's trophy from Naqvi, also ACC chairman, amidst fan boos. This unprecedented incident sparked widespread calls for Naqvi's removal, with Pakistani politicians and critics alleging he destroyed cricket by sidelining talent and making politically motivated decisions.

title: ‘Cruelty by husband’: Crimes against women up marginally in 2023 - NCRB report
content: Crimes against women in India marginally increased by 0.7% in 2023, reaching 4.48 lakh cases, with "cruelty by husband or relatives" accounting for the largest share. The NCRB reported 29,670 rape cases, including 852 victims under 18. Uttar Pradesh recorded the highest total cases, while Delhi had the highest crime rate per lakh women.

title: 'Kantara Chapter 1': Has the Rishab Shetty film impressed audiences?
content: Rishab Shetty’s highly anticipated 'Kantara: A Legend – Chapter 1' is gearing up for a grand worldwide release on October 2, 2025. Early premiere reviews present a mixed picture; while some laud its grandeur, technical prowess, and intense performances, critic Umair Sandhu deemed it "Overrated & Weird." Despite the varied initial feedback, the prequel has already shattered advance booking records, selling over 1.7 lakh tickets worth Rs 5.7 crore.

title: Ex-NHL star Sean Avery doubts Auston Matthews’ ability to win with Maple Leafs
content: Auston Matthews, after an injury-plagued season, faces renewed scrutiny following the Maple Leafs' preseason losses. Former NHL player Sean Avery publicly questioned Matthews' championship potential. This comes despite GM Brad Treliving recently commending Matthews' early preparation and dedication to his craft.

title: Banks, courts, parks: What’s open and closed in government shutdown?
content: The United States faces a government shutdown by Tuesday midnight. President Trump and Congress are deadlocked over a spending bill. Hundreds of thousands of federal employees could face furloughs. Trump also threatens permanent layoffs. Food aid, postal service, and federal law enforcement will continue operations. National parks and museums may close. Both parties trade blame for the impasse.

title: 26/11 attack: Chidambaram says foreign pressure blocked retaliation; BJP hits out
content: BJP criticized Congress following P Chidambaram's statement. He revealed foreign pressure prevented 26/11 retaliation. BJP questioned the Manmohan Singh government's response. They sought answers from Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi. BJP highlighted the delay in Chidambaram's admission. They contrasted this with current government actions. Chidambaram confirmed external influence on the decision.

title: Cardi B vs Nicki Minaj feud: All you need to know amid pregnancy buzz
content: Cardi B and Nicki Minaj reignited their rivalry. Cardi B's new album debuted at number one. Nicki Minaj criticized album sales and pricing. Cardi B responded with comments. Fans debated the feud online. This rivalry dates back to 2018. It involves chart-topping careers and fan loyalty. The feud continues to spark conversations.

title: Asia Cup: PCB punishes Pakistan players for defeat vs India? All NOC cancelled
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board has suspended all foreign T20 league NOCs for its players following their Asia Cup final defeat to India. This drastic move impacts key stars like Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi, reportedly to encourage focus on domestic cricket.

title: Break old institutional silos, move towards jointness: Min to forces
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh urged armed forces to embrace "jointness" across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace, calling it a survival necessity against evolving threats and cyber warfare. Concurrently, CDS General Anil Chauhan stressed India's preparedness for increasing biothreats and potential radiological contamination, highlighting the need to integrate these into national security calculus despite low nuclear weapon use probability.

title: Over 4.4 lakh lives lost in 2023 accidents, a rise of 3%: NCRB data
content: India recorded over 4.4 lakh accident deaths in 2023. Daily, 1,217 lives were lost, a 3% rise from 2022. Traffic accidents, including road and rail, caused 45% of these fatalities. Road crashes claimed 1.74 lakh lives. Rail accidents resulted in 24,000 deaths. Sudden deaths increased by 12.3%, with heart attacks claiming 35,637 lives. Animal attacks also rose.

title: Monsoon season ends; India gets 8% more than normal rainfall - 5th highest since 2001
content: India's southwest monsoon season concluded with 8% above-normal rainfall, the fifth-highest since 2001. Conversely, East and North-East India experienced a severe deficit, recording their second-lowest rainfall since 1901. Despite localized disasters, robust rains significantly increased Kharif crop acreage, raising hopes for record foodgrain output. Above-normal rainfall is anticipated for October-December, potentially delaying the winter monsoon's onset.

title: Deadline to switch from NPS to UPS now Nov 30
content: The government has extended the deadline for central government employees to switch from the National Pension System (NPS) to the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) until November 30, 2025. This decision, prompted by a tepid initial response and recent scheme changes, allows more eligible employees, retirees, and spouses of deceased past retirees to opt for the new pension framework.

title: Punjab: Amit Shah assures CM Mann of support to flood-hit state
content: Home Minister Amit Shah assured Punjab of central support for flood relief after CM Bhagwant Mann sought additional funds. The Centre noted Punjab has ample disaster funds and has already released Rs 805 crore from a Rs 1,600 crore package announced by PM Modi. However, Punjab is yet to submit a detailed memorandum for further assistance.

title: This MP village bears Ravan’s name, chants his chalisa
content: In Rawan village near Bhopal, residents uniquely worship Ravan as their 'gram devta', reciting 'Ravan Chalisa' and performing aartis. Unlike the rest of the country, they host grand feasts and pujas for Ravan on Dussehra, considering the burning of his effigy painful. This centuries-old tradition reflects their deep pride and devotion to Ravan.

title: Taylor Swift embarrassed by Blake Lively amid legal chaos reports
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship has reportedly ended after a process server, linked to Lively's legal dispute with Justin Baldoni, was arrested at Travis Kelce's home. Swift felt "humiliated" and betrayed by the incident, leading her to distance herself from Lively. She is now focusing on her wedding plans with Kelce.

title: Tyreek Hill injury FAQ: Recovery timetable, his NFL future and how Dolphins will adapt
content: Tyreek Hill likely to miss at least the remainder of the 2025 regular season . it's a massive blow to a team that picked up its first win of the season but now must claw back from a 1-3 record without a player who has been the NFL's preeminent home run threat for the past decade . "Next man up," running back de'Von Achane says of losing Hill after Monday's game .

title: 17 new coordinators: Who’s passing the grade so far and who’s struggling
content: Corey Hetherman is a respected coordinator from Minnesota . hetherman, Gus Malzahn and Tony White are among those hired . the team is ninth nationally in points allowed (11.5 PPG) and tied for eighth against the run .

title: Springer's Hartford Whalers batting gloves to be donated to Hockey Hall of Fame
content: springer's batting gloves will go to the hockey hall of fame in Toronto . the 36-year-old outfielder is a native of new Britain, Connecticut . springer is entering the postseason on the back of a resurgent 2025 campaign .

title: LeBron's future, Celtics' goals sans Tatum: Biggest question for all 30 teams
content: despite 22 days separating the preseason from opening night, not every team's offseason storylines have been resolved . how will the saga trickle into the Golden State Warriors ' season; how the LA Clippers will handle the league's investigation into Kawhi Leonard . what are the expectations for the Indiana Pacers this season are just some of the largest stories to follow .
